alert.note: Alert for Culebra (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 16 at 4:10PM AST until January 18 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MONDAY TO 6 AM AST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 10 feet. For the Rip Currents, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Beaches of Culebra. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Monday to 6 AM AST Tuesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
